qPQg25wn4zAw-RrR05uHuA.text: Kampong Bahru Road, Outram ParkI've written before about Outram Park in Singapore, where four quality cafes operate within a 10 minute walk of each other. Strangers Reunion is one of those cafes, and it doesn't disappoint. This is an interesting cafe, with a very distinct look and atmosphere, and most importantly, well crafted coffee.The espresso shot had a light mouthfeel, but a strong and robust flavour. It wasn't bitter or citrusy - the dominant flavour was woody and earthy. This is an interesting combination, and it worked for me. The crema on the shot was dark brown, and the volume was correct - this tells me that it's a shot made from fresh beans, extracted for the correct length of time. Bonus points for the friendly staff, who knew exactly what blend of beans were used, and were happy to talk coffee. This is great - I love seeing this in a cafe - staff who clearly love coffee too.I ordered a cappuccino too. This was smooth as silk, with soft foam, and steamed to perfection. The coffee flavour is slightly muted by the milk, but is still there - it's a good mix of taste and texture, and one of the better cappuccinos that I've had. There is an underlying sweetness also - this is from the lactose in the milk itself, and is brought out by steaming. More importantly, it is brought about by steaming at an appropriate temperature - it's a learned skill, and this tells me that this was an experienced barista. The foam layer was about right too - by no means was this one of the "latte in disguise" coffees that I've noticed in a few places lately. The overall aesthetic is quite distinct - I like the overall effect. The cement floor, rugs, subdued lighting and unique furniture ensure that Strangers has carved out it's own niche, distinguishing itself from any number of independent cafe's which have opened lately. I quite like that the cafe doubles as a gallery, supporting local artists - something that encourages repeat visits.Overall, this was a good coffee experience, and there is one more coffee place that I can add to the list of places that I would recommend to friends. What stands out for me were the staff, more than one of whom asked about the standard of coffee - this is a sign of staff who are engaged in what they are doing, and want to serve good shots. They did, and I'll be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Cappuccino
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Single Espresso
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

kR9M8CJLOeYnwe_SX3QjrA.text: Do not be fooled by the "cuteness" and "charm" of this place. My coworkers and I ventured out to try this joint for lunch and not only was there a lack of any service, but our food was delivered one by one at a slow pace. While asking politely after 25 minutes of waiting, the "owner" or "manager" defended this piece of shit establishment by saying "we only have a staff of 4". I mean do you not have any common sense? It is the lunch rush and you have a staff of 4? Logistically, I am not in the F&B industry but I am pretty sure a moron can figure this out.On top of all of this, one of the orders was left out- which is another logistically error by not having the server repeat everything.Finally, the last straw- no remorse from the manager at all, then accusing us of ordering things that we never ordered, with no SORRY for the missed lunch for our co-worker, not even offered to knock off the pathetic 10% they call service.In the words of you Singaporean people... "CHEAT MY MONEY!"DO NOT EAT HERE.

FDWG0dvwRUHOx2Zb82R-NQ.text: A relatively new entry into the atas-coffee market, Strangers Reunion is a lovely mix of coffee, food, and rustic furniture. I appreciate that they open late (9am-10pm!) because this looks to be an excellent chillout spot after work.I won't comment on the coffee because I'm not much of a coffee person. I really enjoyed the lychee martini cake though I think the pulled pork sandwich (sio bak is not pulled pork!) needs some working on--it feels like it wants to be a version of banh mi, but what is hoisin sauce doing in there? I have great hopes for their noms though, it's not hard to see how dedicated they are to getting things just so. Like:-relaxed atmosphere, decor that feels light and whimsical (flowers in jam jars!)-dedication to quality: the oven is in use all day, for their cakes and breads-creativity! what attracted me to the lychee martini cake was the use of bubble tea "tadpoles" as a topping; it added a great texture, and the balance of sweetness and alcohol was great too-refills of water: water is delivered with the menus, and one of their staff comes by ever so often to keep the glasses topped up. Hurray!Dislike:-service needs to speed up--especially since it's the working crowd that is being served at lunch!-NETS and cash only--perhaps later?I think they're still working out the kinks--looking forward to a new fixture at lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Pulled pork sandwich. I imagined it to be a version of banh mi, but it was sio bak instead of pulled pork, there wasn't enough p
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Mocha with coffee art
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Lychee martini cake

BdpWe7DRD-kl-cVii1Fljg.text: Yeah to free curb side parking on weekends! I can see how it can be a pain if you are planning to grab a cuppa on a weekday during office hours.The coffee is good, we didn't try the food. Full bodied and rich.Not sure if it is because it is a weekend, but the crowd is amazingly young! Like all early twenties. We felt that we brought up the average age the moment we stepped in. LOL.

AAidUPHrEQ16jNgs31wzfw.text: This small shop can be found amongst the row of shop houses and if you don't look out for it, it can be easily missed. Heard that the owner is a national barista champion, means to say the coffee he makes should be of excellent standard.The pastries and food found there are not of much variety but just enough to keep customers coming back for more. My favourite would have to be the waffles as it has the perfect combination of a crispy surface with a soft and fluffy middle. The mocha i tried was good as well, not very chocolaty but still alright for my taste buds.Service was very good, they made us feel at home and it was spot on. Overall i would come back for more lovely coffee and snacks.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

9sEMningZMsyzfhH2LYPTQ.text: Strode down here on a very, very hot day (what else do you expect!) - a pretty enjoyable 10-minute walk from Outram Park MRT, word had been traveling around that Strangers' Reunion has had the Singapore National Barista champion working in it (aha!) - the coffee connoisseur in me just started screaming and kicking.The café has an earthy feel to it - the floor is pretty gritty and specked with beautiful polished mahogany cabinets and tables, and the air-conditioning on full blast (comfy for the first 30 minutes - after that you miss the humidity & warmth outside!).And the cofffee - the cappuccino was what I had (yes I had it hot despite the weather I'd just braved) - was looking too pretty to drink (drank it anyway), and being a staunch supporter of Papa Palheta, it is a huge compliment when I say it almost tastes as good! It was acceptable price-wise as well.A downer was the selection of cakes and desserts. Looked at the dessert fridge and I saw a whole cake (can't remember what it is now, didn't look very appetising, probably lime or something green), and a pathetic looking last-slice of red velvet looking sloppy and damaged... we gave them a skip. It was probably the time (6 pm), but shouldn't they have refreshed the cake spread already? Will be back for the coffee (and hopefully) cake as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Divine!
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Cappucino!

LyzCXnY1PiyPQqqmGYDSKg.text: Checked out Strangers' Reunion two Saturdays ago after attending the Singapore Blog Awards 2012 at the Singapore Flyer, together with @stooffi and another friend. I've heard so much about the place and we had some time to kill so we decided to pay the cafe a visit.So it is actually beside a big main road in a row of shophouses with a super eclectic mix of tenants.The cafe is actually a long rectangular space. When we stepped in the place was positively buzzing. I quite liked the decor up front though. Very typical of indie cafes, but its charming nonetheless. Coffees and teas are $3.5-$8. I heard the barista is quite well-known among the indie coffee scene.So what happened was that there were a few class gatherings just right beside us on the right that filled up the entire cafe with loud sounds. It was at least 15 people squeezed up against tiny tables just chattering in competing volumes. I had a iced latte once again, while my friend ordered a latte. Our friend had a sandwich which looked quite mediocre and tasted just so as well. For the coffee itself, I really cannot give it an accurate rating.What I can say was that the crowd and the noise actually drove us away and I was downing my iced latte like it was a glass of vodka cranberry. Perhaps the crowd took the word "reunion" quite literally and held their class reunions there.However I do see the potential in this place - if there are only a few human beings around. I can imagine it as a quiet cafe that will go perfectly with a book and some Olivia Ong.It being sufficiently close to Tanjong Pagar/Outram also makes it relatively easy to revisit.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

FRrYVR1s7Xsz7cQnH5hlaA.text: I hate giving bad reviews to local restaurants, especially establishments I would easily become a regular at. That said...The quality of the coffee it the only reason I even gave two stars. There service was TERRIBLE. Took an hour to make 1 waffle with a scoop of ice cream. Come on.... The rest of the food was blah.

5O9qlQbf78YI2iVtLIlkeg.text: Referred here by a friend along with a description of 'shabby chic', I guess I had high expectations of the place... very busy on a Sunday afternoon, yet service was friendly and efficient. Long black was very bright and distinct notes on the palate. Unfortunately the flat white was weaker and maybe a bit more tepid than I'm used to... I like my coffees super hot. The carrot cake from the cabinet display was delicious though. A soy latte was also ordered by my companion and deemed to pass the test. Fun and funky, I would come back if I was in the area.

3bPG4QyNmpJoVrFQ6MUaVw.text: Ok food, but poor service. Closed on Tuesdays.Had to ask three times for a glass of ice. Food and drinks brought randomly.

rpOaiqQzbry0YESFL1DTDw.text: Strangers' Reunion is one of the popular new haunts of late and I was happy to finally be able to head down for a lunchtime meal one day. The place has been heavily pictured by bloggers around since it has a great rustic edge to its decor. Perfect for groups of 2-3 to head down since it is filled with random coffee tables. Best not to try big groups - that'll just spoil your experience.The menu options is pretty limited but it makes sense since they have only a tiny "kitchen", or rather counter space. I heard a lot about their buttermilk waffles so I decided to order them topped with greek yoghurt and fruit. I liked it enough to decide to come back again for you, so you definitely should give it a go.I also had a cup of their "magic" coffee. Checking up online, I learnt that it was made with 2 shots of ristretto so expect a rather strong drink balanced with nicely frothed milk. It had a familiar taste profile to Terra Firma of Loysels' Toy/Papa Pahelta fame but is bolder in execution. The cakes and pies aren't as exciting looking though. I'll give those a miss.Not too bad a place, was glad that it isn't as gimmicky as it could've been. Surprised that we could order from our table despite no service charge and service was friendly. Will return.

HMdewpRuMcVgkCU-dvNlDg.text: Came here for a quick lunch just to see what the buzz is about - there are a few notable coffee places along the same area - highlander coffee on the same road and nylon coffee not very far from here, so you can do a mini coffee hop if you're a coffee freak like me. I ordered a flat white and a sandwich, my friend ordered the waffle. Coffee was definitely...better than starbucks and the sandwich was delish - I had the tandoori chicken sandwich, very generous portion of it.Really loved the cozy ambience, random pieces of vintage furniture, my favourite part of it was the fresh flowers on each table. Perfect!Only downside is the parking, you'll have to find a parallel parking space behind at kampung bahru road or park at everton park's hdb carpark, either way its abit of a walk on a hot day. But if you're taking the train, it's just across the road from outram mrt, just got to get to the cantonment exit!Final verdict: The name of the cafe is a mouthful as compared to the bland two-syllable "starbucks" but at least it puts its money where its mouth is - strangers basically reunite here time and again for the good coffee, food and ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. great coffee, fresh flowers, strangers' reunion

mrhRq88F0-lUpNcmANB5Sg.text: With so many different coffee joints serving up gourmet coffee sprouting up all over Singapore, it does get a little confusing to know where to go. Introduced by a friend who's always checking out new places, Strangers's Reunion is probably one of the best I've had so far. It's a pity that the place is fairly small. However, the coffee is spot on. It's also due to the Papa Palheta beans and that the barista is the winner of the National Barista Championship. There aren't much options when it comes to snacking, just desserts like cakes and yoghurts and your standard sandwiches. But if you're here, its more for the coffee than food anyways.

B48AxL04Kj_TFjvNY5Q-yg.text: Only for those soft, cloudy waffles with glorious double drizzle of maple syrup and loads of fruits.... I would go here everyday. Coffee is average at best, nice ambience though albeit the tiny chairs! :)

MESpzDLSsUZ3sf8yqUm_Ow.text: very nice and friendly staffs. The waffle is good. I love the café latte. The ambience is suitable couples.

Jsxz2lCMoKNpL1m8M9e7ig.text: Best latte ever found in Singapore though a bit expensive but worth it when miss real coffee once in a while.

96ZcYe2-5C8hc-SmFaNqfg.text: I'm not a huge coffee person, so please take my review with a pinch of salt. I've been here twice, and to be honest, I didn't really enjoy the coffee that much. My first time here I had a flat white with their house blend, and the second time I came i had a latte with their Axil beans. I prefer my coffee a bit more bold, and both coffees were bit too bright and acidic for me.What I like about this place though is the service and the ambience. Their waiters really do know their coffee, which is a pleasant change from your average cafe. One of the biggest allures to drinking coffee at an "atas" joint like this is the story behind the coffee. It's thus no surprise that their main customers base is the hipster crowd: expats and yuppies. The store has also done a good job of creating a nice modern space while still retaining the traditional feel of a shophouse.I may not come back for the coffee, but this joint is still a nice place to hang out with friends.

RZqFNncZKhacLtWkMo0oeA.text: What happens when there is the Singapore National Barista champion working in a cafe? You get awesome coffee complete with latte art! As for food, I tried their roast pork sandwich that is a quite delightful- a Baguette with Chinese shio bak.  Seating is a bit cramp as the cafe is quite narrow. People above 175cm may find it hard to navigate. Don't let that stop you from enjoying your coffee though! Just don't ask for sugar!

raxF8uvAJSaxjy619jk_WA.text: Update 28 JunFavorite Sandwich - 3.5 starsBacon and egg sandwich on olive ciabatta with rocket on the side. Decent but nothing special.Salmon and kale - 4 starsSalmon was cooked perfectly and a good size.$43 for both.=============Smoked beet and duck salad ($12.90 before GST and service charge) - 4 starsA good portion of spinach, duck, pomegranate, cheese, pine nuts, sweet potato and beets with just the right amount of flavoring - the duck was salted but not too much. Not a huge fan of the way the beets were cooked but I'll live. I want to give it more stars but there's something about the dish overall that I didn't quite enjoy. Maybe it's just because I've had too many sweet potato salads at home. But for the price and portion it's one of the better salads I've had here for sure. 3.75 for the flavors, 0.25 for the price and portion.Soy matcha latte ($5.90 + $0.60 for soy = $6.50 before GST++) - 4 starsPricey because it's small. Flavor was rich and good.I want to come back for the waffles and cakes! They offer a dinner menu after 6pm too. Open daily from 9am-10pm but closed on Tuesdays.

dAVzvDvr05A_qBuJA4qDiw.text: Excellent brunch place! Very hipsterish look, reminded me of PDX!I got the baked eggs which to my pleasant surprise was very close to a shaksouka, and with excellent side of olive bread. The wife got a goat cheese omlette which was great too. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. The latte
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Baked eggs. Delicious. Like shaksouka
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. The goat cheese omelette

ErVqh9Io-nF1t-GshWSMgA.text: Bad first impression! Rude staff on the phone. Sent an email and told me someone will revert back. NO ONE REVERTED!!

lMDrzg0GO1JOJ4p1Sw-qjA.text: Strangers Reunion does offers some really good brunch dishes and unfrtonatley that means that on weekends there is really a rush here so the atmosphere is not the best to actually enjoy a nice weekend brunch. While the food is actually very good (I had excellent waffles and good eggs on toast) I always feel slightly rushed and stressed here. The service is very up and down here, sometimes it is totally absent, at other times almost rude and then times just confused (mixed up orders, not understanding the order). The food has however been very good and that is the reason I have returned. The coffee is clearly better than your average place but I believe it has slipped since I first visited in 2012 or so. They can still deliver some good cups but they are not as consistent as they used to be. Still a good place but not worth going out of your way to reach but if you are around it is good enough,

UgwX9mj_O-4xVCFVEhPxOQ.text: Stranger's Reunion is the home of the three-time and current Singapore National Barista Champion & the winner of ASEAN Barista Championship 2013.As usual, I woke up and want and in need of a good cup of coffee. Kampong Bahru Road seems to be the area to go with a couple of good coffee shops, at least according to Yelp's reviews. There was no lines when we arrived around 10:30 am and got seated right away. Coffee, I want Coffee...Magic ($5.50) - Double Ristretto + Milk (according to their menu is supposed to the the magic ratio of coffee and milk) was smooth, mellow but still balance and of course that lovely latte art..My sister which is not a coffee drink (why?!) opt for a Baby Chino ($3) which is steamed milk with foam and sprinkled with cocoa powder. The baby marsh mellow served on the side was just too cute. She also enjoyed her Apricot muffin ($4.50) which was moist and loaded with the fresh fruit.Too bad Ryan is not in the house, it would have been fun to see him in action. Strangers' Reunion has this rustic European vibe. A great place to chill and just have a cup of coffee. Or maybe next time I am in town, I would have one of their waffles!!

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. More baked goodies
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

MCYN2cMsbjXLwcFQMBf78g.text: Where can you can a better cup of coffee in Singapore than from Ryan Kieran Tan, two time National Barista Champion (2011, 2012), 2nd runner up of the World Latte Art Championship 2011 and owner of Strangers' Reunion?Theres a coffee on the menu thats unique and never seen in Singapore cafes, Magic (flat white with a double ristretto base), highly recommended by Ryan himself. On a side note, they recently started serving weekend brunch from 9am to 5pm.When I first saw the cup of cappuccino, I felt the cup looking strangely familiar (no pun intended)... Apparently, Papa Palheta and Loysel's Toy are sisters cafe which explains the similar looking cups. What then is there not to like about Strangers' Reunion? Coffee lovers should definitely pay this place a visit for the next caffeine fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Cappuccino

giATyJP1xKR5F_R2YJ5_Kg.text: This place is extremely crowded and noisy. The tables are too small to hold plates and the chairs are uncomfortable mini-stools. The service is quite poor, with no one tending to the tables in a logical fashion. I had to talk to the person at the register specifically to request a server and cutlery, which ultimately meant that person leaving the register to serve us. No one communicates with the runners, who walk to each table one by one with each dish in a hopeless search for the proper recipient. This is not a case of understaffing, but of poor organization and utilization of the staff. The food was decent, but overpriced. I tried the waffle with mixed berry compote and greek yogurt. The waffle was a little crispy and baked nicely. The toppings combined to form and very sweet and somewhat sour flavor. Overall, you can find much more pleasurable places to have a meal across all factors.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. berry waffle
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. tea
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. sweet potato fries

KXXJ0qUVTz-kM8I7FCIUKw.text: I absolutely love this place!I've been here twice and the place was pretty crowded both times.The staff was quite attentive and I love their milo waffles with caramelized bananas.Definitely something to look forward to.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Milo waffles
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

4wsN_YwKWeHSy8vE_wF9_A.text: Service here starts when you walk in; they all tend to look at you dumbfounded and sullen: "Yes?" Then you order. It confuses them if you don't point at the thing you want on the menu. Most of them look fourteen years old, so don't scare them by saying too much.The music tends to be way too loud but sometimes they'll be nice and turn it down if you ask nicely. The avocado is good. The coffee manages to be both cold and burnt, which is an interesting paradox. Don't order the steak, whatever you do. It was such a deadly cut I almost didn't make it through my business meeting. The next time you want good coffee and great service in the area, go to Highlander next door. They also have smiles for free.

tDN8veOyTXPFIkuGecO8yA.text: Came here for brunch on a Sun and we were quite lucky that a table just emptied for us without much wait. The staff was very efficient in cleaning the table for us to sit.Food tasted very fresh. The 'sausage lover' has a good mix of 3 different kinds of sausages. The eggs benedict which my sister-in-law had looked very yummy.The truffle fries did not have enough truffle essence to it so we could hardly taste the truffle...The waffle... perhaps I should have ordered it with Greek yogurt or should have asked for the maple syrup on the side as it turned out to be drenched a bit in syup so too sweet for us.The capuccino and latte that my in-laws had, both of them raved about them. I tried the 'magic' and I think it has a bit too sour taste for me. I will definitely come try the latte next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. truffle fries
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. waffle with fruit and maple syrup
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. sausage lover

98f7_S9QihGKxKBH4hSdew.text: Had a late lunch on a Saturday. The place was packed but service staff was fast and efficient. I like the coffee, rich and at the right temperature. We ordered the scrambled eggs and Benedict. I love it that the hollandaise sauce is on the side. Good and simple! I will come back for the waffles!

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

Jv3KsSH-cyQD6JZs92yyFg.text: The good I came here with Cindy Q while we were on the Yelp Coffee Trail :) She ordered a "cup of magic"  for me and a pie? The former I was great. The latter I can't say was very memorable. The secret behind the cup of magic is that it has 2 ristretto shots with a thick milk foam on top... & it's loving created by one of Singapore's reigning champion barista. Goes without saying... it was a marvelous cup of coffee. The pretty Ambiance - I love the homely, country feel to the place :) The squeezeyyy... My only gripe with the place might be that it is way too crowded. You can't get up (literally) without elbowing your fellow coffee lovers.Oh well... signs of a hidden treasure going mainstream. All the best to the owners!

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

9J4Swjo3cbN-Eyqf1VhNrA.text: Awesome waffles with great service! Had the waffles with vanilla ice cream and fruits as well as the truffle fries. Both were really tasty! I am also particularly impressed with the playlist, it really made the atmosphere very chill and pleasant. I would love to know the name of the playlist!

IU_hHbCoHRRy4AcQiMTgxQ.text: Great waffle, not so great service. Have been there twice and service was slow both times. We had to wave several times before someone would come to take our order. We could never find anyone when we wanted to pay. The second time I just went to the cashier directly. They don't accept cards for orders under 20 dollars. The food was good though. The waffle was fantastic. I would definitely give it a 5 star if the service was better.

WC60to3m54I89MlL7as10g.text: Love the truffle fries and the sauce that comes with it, just cant stop from putting one fries after the other. Also,  the looks of the pancakes can't be compared with the taste of it. It a MUST TRY. I went on a weekday afternoon where I see queues outside the store, it took around 5 to 10 min before my turn. However the food is definitely worth the wait. Pancake lovers, you need to come try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Truffle fries is a must order at strangers renunion!
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore. Pancakes topped with vanilla ice cream!

sQeRjC9JiUZkMu-LwXUnow.text: This is a little cafe in Kampung Bahru with illegible sign and okay food. Anyone's first trip to this place will start with looking weirdly at the sign thinking if this is Stranger's Reunion. On a Sunday afternoon, your chances of getting a seat is slim and when you do, you don't really want to stay long after you eat. Before I had a chance to order, I was served twice with delicious looking food that I of course did not order. As soon as I ordered, I was presented with a waffle that I did not order either. Seriously??Food wise, it was pretty good. I ordered their corn and zucchini fritters that came with spinach and a poach egg. The flavors were just right and portion reasonable for the price.So why not more stars? The ambiance were just rushed and unorganized for a cafe. While their food was good, it was not the best and with so many unique cafés in Singapore, there really is no reason to come back here. Definitely not on a laid back Sunday.

rfgT51Z7-2i_Wv4KT8Qkyw.text: Brunch should be about two things.. Good food and good times and that's exactly what we got today at Strangers Reunion. Service was super quick, the Eggs On Toast were light and fluffy, and the waffles were sensational. Perfectly sweetened, and not too thick - can't wait to come back for more!

p75nva_lZzZnufDh3bSb2A.text: I enjoy coming here on Sundays for coffee and a bite. Andrew (no longer works Sundays) and Cheryl are all really warm and enthusiastic. My favourite drink is the cup of magic but I sometimes make do with a latte. On Sundays now they have eggs benedict/royale. Only downside is you come out smelling like smoky food. Love the decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Strangers' Reunion - Singapore, Singapore

hLe2g0uA-IbDPzNYIoOmiw.text: I didn't know about this apparently very popular place until a few weeks ago, when I met up with a friend who lives in the area. We ordered a latte, macha latte and spam fries. The coffee was good, the macha latte lacked flavor, and the spam fries were so-so. They were cut too big and we're not crunchy at all. It was like eating normal spam.

bCLkU40ZDPflrBHBWCk6WQ.text: One of the first of the hipster cafes! This is practically an institution amongst the hipster crowd, methinks.I used to work across the road from this place and so it was the to-go whenever my colleagues and I felt like having something different from the usual hawker food in the area. It was also my source of comfort food/coffee in the early mornings, after working through the night. As such I have eaten here so many times that this review is going to be a bit too long...1. Coffee - I find the coffee here too acidic- from lattes to mochas to their famed "magic" (the first time a coworker asked me to help him order this I looked at him dubiously as though he was asking me to get him some drugs). Umm... good if you like your coffees sour but IMO Highlander's down the block is much better.2. Brunch - have never gone wrong with the brunch options here, your usual eggs-and-toast. Scrambled eggs were much better than the poached from what I remember. 3. Lunch - pastas are good, but get the truffle fries and the more special spam fries with lime kafir mayo to share! Spam fries are so so so sinful but go really well with the lime mayo - my ultimate comfort food after an overnight shift.4. Dinner - had beef tacos here a really long time ago which were MEH - dry, tasteless, bland, looks like it was put together in less than a minute. But I heard that they've changed their dinner menuBUT THE REAL GEM IN THIS PLACE ISWAFFLES! Their waffles look VERY typical and nothing too extraordinary but they are perfect! (Was not surprised when the folks here decided to open a waffle shop next door) Fluffy, light, not too dense- looks simple but tastes SO GOOD. In fact these are probably my favourite waffles in Singapore! If you only have space for one thing, get the waffles. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
